content:
Dubai! I'm glad you mentioned that. Yes, it's always a good idea to double-check the voltage and frequency ratings for any electrical device, including power strips, to ensure they're compatible with the local electrical system.

And I'm glad you had a relatively smooth experience with adapters in Dubai! 50 dirhams is a reasonable price for an adapter, especially considering the convenience of buying it at the airport.

It's always a good idea to be prepared and research the electrical standards for your destination before traveling. But it's also good to know that you can often find adapters and converters at airports or local electronics stores if you need them.

By the way, how was your trip to Dubai? Did you have a favorite experience or attraction?
